I’ve got the Orange Pi Photonvision image flashed onto my USB and it boots into Ubuntu 24.04. With the docs I’ve logged in with the preset password and user, but I have no idea on where to go next. How would I go about accessing the web dashboard from here?

How can I see if it’s even connected to the internet through the Ethernet port it’s plugged into?

Do I have sufficient power going to the Pi? (Suppose not because it doesn’t boot if connected via HDMI, I have to plug it in after it boots.)

Please provide me with help!! I have no knowledge on how to navigate the Ubuntu software.

posts.name: Qworg
posts.cooked:
photonvision.local:5800 is the web address a fresh Photonvision install will show up. Make sure the computers are on the same network.

You almost certainly don’t have enough power. This will create all sorts of weird instabilities.

Thanks for the help,

But nothing happens when I put that into my laptop, they should be connected to the same network. I have the orange pi connected through Ethernet directly to the modem and my laptop through wifi. Is there any required setup?

posts.name: Owen Busler
posts.cooked: you ideally should never have to look at the hdmi output, all photon vision configuration should be through the web portal. that being said, the screenshot you shared appears as if the OrangePi isnt connected to a network. If its possible, try using an actual robot?
Sure thing, I’ll try connect it to the robot and keep you updated. In that state should I theoretically be able to access the web ui from there?

posts.name: Owen Busler
posts.cooked: Yes, assuming photon vision boots up and joins the network you should be able to Access the Webber dashboard

posts.name: Craig Schardt
posts.cooked:
First, you should use a power supply that provides at least 5V 3A.

It looks like the networking isn’t configured correctly, but I’m not sure why. You’re using an old version of Photonvision. The newer version has network management improvements that may fix the problem you’re having. Please try flashing v2025.1.1-rc1 image from https://github.com/PhotonVision/photonvision/releases/tag/v2025.1.1-rc1 .

If that doesn’t work, I can help you with some debugging steps.

Hey, thanks for the reply

I’m going to test it tomorrow when I get to the robot, but I can’t even get it to power on now.

I’ve switched over to a 200mbs sd card and plugged it into a 60w phone charger brick. Now it seems that I can’t get it to turn on any more.

So firstly, I tried to power it on without the sd card through my PC and the light went whiteish indicating it’s on. Then I plugged in my SD card, but the light was stuck on red,even if I held down the power button it still would turn on.

I assumed that it was because there was not enough power going to the OPi, so I plugged it into that fast charger brick I was talking about and as I plugged it in the light “flickered” on and of for like 0.3 seconds before going red, once again no power.

I removed the ss card and plugged it back into the pc it power on, then back to the brick without the sd no light what so ever. Then I switched to a lower wattage brick, and it turned on to red. But never booted

And now I’m stuck here with an OPi 5+ that doesn’t want to boot.

Can you give me any advice?

image 3024×4032 3.53 MB

image 3024×4032 3.53 MB

image 3024×4032 3.53 MB

posts.name: Qworg
posts.cooked: How much amperage can your 60w charger provide? Some systems have lower amperage levels at lower voltage levels. You really want to see 5V @ 4A (3 may cut it).

Thanks for that,

Turns out the amperage is only 2A (Not sure if I’m correct but it says 5v = 2A) which definitely won’t be enough as we found out. I did get it to power on again, turns out the cable I used was faulty.

It sometimes doesn’t turn on and when it does it boot loops. I think this is because of the amperage shortage.

I’ll test it out at the workshop today.

THANKS ALL FOR THE HELP!

Photon vision is running.

I do have one problem.

The frame rate is only 24. The chosen camera is an OV2311 and on paper it should output at 1600x1200 at at least 90 fps. I’m only given an option to do 50 fps and the output is I only about half of it at 24.

Anyone had a similar issue?
